paper_abstract: Given a set I of words, the set L-proves 1(epsilon) of all words obtained by the shuffle of (copies of) words of I is naturally provided with a partial order: for u, v in L u proves(*)(I) v if and only if v is the shuffle of u and another word of L-proves I(epsilon). In [3], the authors have stated the problem of the characterization of the finite sets I such that proves(*)(I) is a well quasi-order on L-proves I(epsilon). In this paper we give the answer in the case when I consists of a single word w.
paper_title: Well quasi orders and the shuffle closure of finite sets
